myMath

Class Polynom

  • java.lang.Object
    • myMath.Polynom
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    myMath.cont_function, myMath.function, myMath.Polynom_able

    public class Polynom
extends java.lang.Object
implements myMath.Polynom_able
    This class represents a polynomial with add, multiply functionality, it also should support the following: 1. Riemann's Integral: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Riemann_integral 2. Finding a numerical value between two values (currently support root only f(x)=0). 3. Derivative
    Author:
    Inna and Chen

      double root(double x0, double x1, double eps)
      Compute the approximate value of polynomial's roots by: compute a value x' (x0 smaller/equal to x'smaller/equal to x1) for with |f(x')| smaller than eps assuming f(x0)*f(x1) smaller/equal to 0, returns f(x2) such that: (i) x0 smaller/equal to x2 smaller/equal to x1 and (ii) f(x2) smaller than eps reference source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bisection_method

      • root

        public double root(double x0,
                   double x1,
                   double eps)
        Compute the approximate value of polynomial's roots by: compute a value x' (x0 smaller/equal to x'smaller/equal to x1) for with |f(x')| smaller than eps assuming f(x0)*f(x1) smaller/equal to 0, returns f(x2) such that: (i) x0 smaller/equal to x2 smaller/equal to x1 and (ii) f(x2) smaller than eps reference source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bisection_method
        Specified by:
        root in interface myMath.Polynom_able
        Parameters:
        x0 - starting point
        x1 - end point
        eps - step (positive) value
        Returns:
